page.title: 11SPORT 1
page.content: In l984 a new Sports Centre for use by the general public was opened at Peers School. During a typical week in March it was used by 333 adults and 202 children. A week in July saw it being used by 459 adults and 4l0 children. We decided to find out what potential there was for more people to use it. 284 local people were interviewed. 94 were under l6, 62 were aged l6-24, 64 were aged 25-39, 37 were aged 40-50 and 27 were over 50. The ratio of male and female was equal. 52% did not know that there was a Sports Centre. 40% had received or seen publicity about the Centre. 78% of those who did know about it had used it. 26% used it more than once a week, 30% about once a week and 22% once a month or less often.
